title: Craufurd baronets
text:
The Craufurd Baronetcy, of <a href="Kilbirnie">Kilbirney</a> in south-west Scotland ("North Britain" in the terminology of the time), is a title in the <a href="Baronetage%20of%20Great%20Britain">Baronetage of Great Britain</a>. It was created on 8 June 1781 for Alexander Craufurd, the member of an ancient Scottish family. The General and Major-General were elected to the <a href="Nottinghamshire">Nottinghamshire</a> <a href="East%20Retford%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">East Retford (UK Parliament constituency)</a> of the almost wholly unreformed (pre-1832) <a href="British%20House%20of%20Commons">House of Commons</a>.
Craufurd baronets, of Kilbirney (1781).
The list also shows notable ranks of siblings of those passing on the title.
The 9th Baronet has three children, all daughters and there is no heir apparent to this baronetcy.
